API Reference

This page hold mrQA’s API documentation, which might be helpful for the neuroimaging community. For the sake of brevity, we highlight the high level API of mrQA. The high-level API would allow your to do the most common tasks.

The most important methods are mrQA.project.check_compliance. Here is a summarized reference of commonly used methods.

High level API

mrQA.project module

mrQA.project.check_compliance(dataset: MRdataset.base.Project, strategy: str = 'majority', output_dir: Optional[Union[pathlib.Path, str]] = None, return_dataset: bool = False) → Optional[MRdataset.base.Project][source]

Main function for checking compliance. Calls individual functions for inferring the most frequent values and then generating the report

Parameters

  • dataset (Project) – MRdataset.base.Project instance for the dataset which is to be checked for compliance

  • strategy (str) – How to get the reference protocol, whether should take most common values as reference or something else

  • output_dir (Union[Path, str]) – Path to save the report

  • return_dataset (bool) – return checked MRdataset.base.Project instance

Returns

dataset – MRdataset.base.Project instance for the dataset which was checked for compliance

Return type

Project

mrQA.project.compare_with_majority(dataset: MRdataset.base.Project) → MRdataset.base.Project[source]

Method for post-acquisition compliance. Infers the reference protocol/values by looking for the most frequent values, and then identifying deviations

Parameters

dataset (Project) – MRdataset.base.Project instance for the dataset which is to be checked for compliance

Returns

dataset – Adds the non-compliance information to the same Project instance and returns it.

Return type

Project

mrQA.project.generate_report(dataset: MRdataset.base.Project, output_dir: Union[pathlib.Path, str]) → None[source]

Generates an HTML report aggregating and summarizing the non-compliance discovered in the dataset.

Parameters

  • dataset (Project) – MRdataset.base.Project instance for the dataset which is to be checked

  • output_dir (Union[Path, str]) – Directory in which the generated report should be stored.

mrQA.project.otg_report(dataset, report_name)[source]

Generate a single line report for the dataset

Parameters

  • dataset (Project) – MRdataset.base.Project instance for the dataset which is to be checked

  • report_name (str) – Filename for the report

mrQA.project.store_reasons(modality, run, subject_name, session_name)[source]

Store the sources of non-compliance like flip angle, ped, tr, te

Parameters

  • modality (MRdataset.base.Modality) – The modality node, in which these sources of non-compliance were found so that these values can be stored

  • run (MRdataset.base.Run) – Non-compliant which was found to be non-compliant w.r.t. the reference

  • subject_name (str) – Non-compliant subject’s name

  • session_name (str) – Non-compliant session name

mrQA.utils module

mrQA.utils.extract_reasons(data)[source]

Given a list of tuples, extract all the elements at index 1, and return as a list

Parameters

data (List of tuples) –

Returns

List of values at index 1

Return type

list

mrQA.utils.majority_attribute_values(iterable, missing=None)[source]

Given a list of dictionaries, it generates the most common values for each key

Parameters

  • iterable (list) – a list of dictionaries

  • missing (python object, default None) – a default value if the key is missing in any dictionary

Returns

Key-value pairs specifying the most common values for each key

Return type

dict

mrQA.utils.timestamp()[source]

Generate a timestamp as a string

Top-level package for mrQA.
